newsitem.title: USA: Bonneville offers only non-firm off-peak power Fri.
newsitem.headline: Bonneville offers only non-firm off-peak power Fri.

text.p: The Bonneville Power Administration (BPA) continued to offer only non-firm surplus power for next-day schedulings, the federal agency said Thursday.
BPA also restricted its offers to off-peak hours, compared with an offer for up to 500 megawatts for peak demand hours on Thursday.
BPA's price offers were unchanged at $16.00 per megawatt hour (MWh) for hours ending 0100-0500 and 2400 PST for both the Northwest and California-Oregon border (COB) deliveries.
Offers for hours ending 0600 and 2300 PST were also steady at $18.00 for all deliveries.
